title: Mel C , 49 , showcases her VERY toned abs in a skimpy orange bralet and sequinned joggers during energetic performance at The Big Feastival
body_text:
Mel C, 49, showcases her VERY toned abs in a skimpy orange bralet and sequinned joggers during energetic performance at The Big Feastival
Mel C flaunted her very toned physique as she took to the stage at The 2023 Big Feastival held on Alex James' Farm in the Cotswolds on Sunday.
The iconic Spice Girls star, 49, looked incredible in a skimpy orange bralet as she displayed her rock hard abs.
Mel lived up to her Sporty Spice name as she completed the look with a pair of blue sequinned jogging bottoms.
The stunner put on a very energetic performance as she showcased her impressive vocals and ran about the stage entertaining the crowd.
Mel joined the likes of Tom Grennan and Mae Muller on the line-up at the three-day family friendly music festival.
Ans: Mel C, 49, flaunted her very toned physique as she took to the stage at The 2023 Big Feastival held on Alex James ' Farm in the Cotswolds on Sunday
Born to perform: The iconic Spice Girls star looked incredible in a skimpy orange bralet as she displayed her rock hard abs
The performance comes after Mel teamed up with Self Esteem and Olivia Dean to record a song roaring England's Women's World Cup squad on to victory.
The song 'Call Me A Lioness' was released last month, the day before the tournament kicked off in Australia and New Zealand and three days before the Lionesses get their quest for glory underway.
Unlike Baddiel and Skinner's iconic Three Lions (It's Coming Home) - which its creators have said is about 'losing' - this tune, produced by an 11-strong team of artists who have come together to form Hope FC, strikes a more upbeat tone.
After the success of the Lionesses at Euro 2022, fans were always unlikely to hear the lyrics 'one year of hurt' in the new tune - although the words 'winning once was not enough' can be heard.
Other similarities include the use of commentary from last year's triumph - a stark contrast to the downbeat footage used in Three Lions - while the new song also name drops players from the national team, much in the same vein as the anthem from 27 years ago.
Proceeds from the track will raise money for charities that support grassroots girls' and women's football, with former Spice Girl Melanie C praising the impact of last year's victory on the sport.
Melanie C said: 'It's been amazing to see the popularity of women's football grow and their incredible win last year was a huge inspiration for this new song for the World Cup.'
She added: 'I'm so privileged to be involved with a whole host of amazing female artists, cheering on our women's team to bring it home again!'
Dancing queen: The stunner put on a very energetic performance as she showcased her impressive vocals and ran about the stage entertaining the crowd
Iconic: Mel lived up to her Sporty Spice name as she completed the look with a pair of blue sequinned track suit
Pals: Mel (R) later posed fro snaps with fellow celeb guest Laura Whitmore (L)
Leggy: The former Love Island star put on a leggy display in a red mini-dress
Mercury-prize nominee Self Esteem described the recording process as 'very fun', adding: 'The Lionesses are the future and I am so proud and excited to get behind them this summer.'
They are joined by Wolf Alice singer Ellie Rowsell, Sports Team's Al Greenwood, Marika Hackman, Rachel Chinouriri, Shura, Jasmine Jethwa, Rose Gray and Highlyy on the track.
Songwriter Glen Roberts conceived the idea for the song after he realised the Lionesses did not have a song of their own while he was celebrating their Women's Euro 2022 victory last year.
